text:
Hi all, trying to find out if there is a way to do what the meeting iframe does but through using api's. So 1. get any free times for a specific date through an api then 3. book a meeting through an api which would send confirmation/video links etc to everyone required.
Any help greatly appreciated!

Hello, I am trying to check if the propertie islead exists in the contact properties, so I did <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/ID/?properties=islead> ... it is added to the response with a null value ... however, I added a property called flavio which does not exists, and it is also added to the response with null value. How can I make sure islead exists?
no endpoint to return all the properties of a contact object? I just want to figure out the properties fieldnames
Hi :wave: I've noticed that `/crm/v3/schemas/<objectType>/purge` is now deprecated, does anyone know what I should use instead

Hi - I'm using the GET*`/crm/v3/objects/tickets`* call and having trouble getting our custom properties to work. For example, we have a custom property called Ticket Reason that I'd like to include in the API call, but it is always returning null in the response. Sample call here:
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/tickets?limit=100&properties=source_type&properties=ticket_reason&archived=false>

1. I'd check you have properties that have that value
2. I'd update your filter to show based on the ticket_reason not being null
